description.narrative: 1) Promote the strengthening of community organizing with a focus on food security and housing development, through actions such as workshops, exchanges, trainings in different themes such as crops, backyard animal management, organic fertilizer production, rainwater capturing and other eco-technologies at low cost in coordination with local authorities. 2) Support access to right to education and training through different education modalities for children and adults, especially those who for economic and social reasons could go or continue their school education or to learn a skill that allows them to improve their livelihood conditions at the home and community level.

participating-org.narrative: Instituto para la Superacion de la Miseria Urbana
